actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the individual alternative minimum tax to allow for the deduction of certain investment expenses and for other purposes.

summary.text: Investment Expense Deduction Act of 1991 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to modify the computation of alternative minimum tax with respect to itemized deductions and net investment income from partnerships. Requires the issuer of an interest in a corporation to determine or classify whether such interest is to be treated as stock or indebtedness (or as in part stock and in part indebtedness). Provides that such determination is binding on all successors to such interest.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the individual alternative minimum tax to allow for the deduction of certain investment expenses and for other purposes.
